course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Cancer Biology
course.description: Fundamentals in the epidemiology, etiology and treatment of cancers; basic mechanisms of carcinogenesis. For LIFS/BIBU students in their fourth year of study.
course.prerequisites: LIFS 3020 OR LIFS 3140

reviews.author: LKY
reviews.comment_content: Its about cancer formation from different perspectives such as cell cycle mutation,growth receptor mutation, viral infections. Very detailed and deep. this course has >1000 slides but most of them are pictures without words.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite good.He will tell u which slides are important,what u dont have to know.
reviews.comment_grading: Both exam and project grades were not released. I got my final grade directly.Nothing to comment.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 open book exam, 1 group project.
Instructor distributes a particular type of cancer to each group randomly,then each group has to present about the given cancer.

reviews.author: zorro
reviews.title: Goooood Grade
reviews.comment_content: About cancer, the disease itself, therapies and what happen in cellular level. Very long ppt for each lesson.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Mak do all the teaching throughout the semester, she is actually reading the whole ppt, very very plain.

But the good thing is, you can learn by reading the ppt by yourself
reviews.comment_grading:
Two parts, the weighting is around 50/50

one group project (poster + 20 min presentation), this part is peer graded

one final essay (3 days to complete, no word limit and the topic give you a lot of freedom for you to write what you want ), graded by the instructors

Personally I wrote around 2000 words

I get an A, but all the scores were not disclosed, so   actually do not have much to reference on.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light workload, I basically didn't attend any lessons or watch the recordings after the first few weeks.

The group project/final topic is self chosen from a given list, so it is possible for you choose a familiar topic and get good grades.

You have plenty of time to prepare for those assignment, no worries.

But you must be very good at presentation/ writing academic essay in order to secure good grades.

reviews.author: whleeae
reviews.title: Take it if you're good at essays and ppt
reviews.comment_content:
Fundamentals of oncology; pretty basic. There is plenty of material to study to I recommend that you don't intend to finish all of it right before your assignments.

Assessment is mostly consisted of individual essay, group presentation, and poster. If you have good presentation and writing skills, it's a good course (I was also recommended by a faculty to take this course)
reviews.comment_teaching: Poon is great! Immaculate English and teaching, which could honestly be a rare combo here in UST. He responds very quickly, so if you have any questions, you can ask away anytime!
reviews.comment_grading: I got an A+! The grade is heavily dependent on your PPT and essay. Don't mess up.
reviews.comment_workload: A bit much. If you have friends who could take this course with you, it wouldn't be much of a problem. However, if you end up with a free-rider, I suggest that you inform Poon right away.

reviews.author: lhtam
reviews.title: Good to take if you're interested in cancer
reviews.comment_content:
1. Cancer basic
2. Epidemiology
3. Viral oncogenes and transformation
4. Oncogenes
5. Tumour suppressor genes
6. Cancer genomics
7. Growth factors and receptors
8. Cytoplasmic signalling
9. Cell cycle
10. Apoptosis
11. Genome instability
12. Senescence and cancer stem cells
13. Tumour microenvironment & angiogenesis
14. Therapies
reviews.comment_teaching: His monotone will make you feel sleepy during lesson but his explanation is clear and detailed
reviews.comment_grading:
Group project (Peer assessed):
Poster - 25%
Presentation - 25%
Attendance (Presentation lectures) - 10%

Individual assessment (Instructor assessed):
Take home essay during final period - 40%

No marks were disclosed but got A range at last, the take home essay should matters a lot as all groupmates will receive the same marks
reviews.comment_workload:
It doesn't really matter if you didn't study LIFS 3010 and 3020 before, he will briefly mention the mechanism again during lecture so don't worry if you're not BCB major

No memorisation is needed as no close-book exam. Just read through them once to familiarise yourself for better understanding in doing project and essay

reviews.author: KB
reviews.comment_content: A normal life science course with many PowerPoint slides and contents about oncology.
reviews.comment_teaching: interesting teaching style by professor poon, he is trying to make a life science course interesting with some pictures and stories.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading is fair enough if you invest enough time in the final essay and the group poster/project presentation.
However, the sub-grade from two assessments cannot be viewed by students, and nothing you can argue with him if you find the grading doesn't make sense.
I would say the average grading should be B/B+
reviews.comment_workload:
low workload if you enjoy a course without examination.
Only one final presentation and one final essay
